comment: He's not a good professor point blank period. HE ALWAYS gets off topic, isn't organized, doesn't help you outside of class as a "GTA" he also has a thick accent, run away from his class. he will google things during lectures, doesn't indent his code WHICH IS HARD TO FOLLOW..... he always does mistakes which honestly gets me lost!

Extremely unorganized. His lectures are all over the place as he keeps jumping from one topic to another and not giving clear examples. The way he structured the quiz and homework assignments was also horrible as he would make the assignments visible only one week before they were due and continuously changed syllabus dates/ didnt respect them.

Super disorganized class, materials don't match up with assignments or quizzes very well. Grades super SUPER easy on hw, but the test questions are written horribly and are overall quite difficult. Very poor communicator, and the syllabus and due dates are constantly shifting. Emails went unanswered. Avoid.

Easy A, but you will not learn anything. A few programming assignments, 3 tests, and 5-6 quizzes. He gives full credit for assignments, even if they are completely wrong. Tests are pretty easy if you're using printed material. Most unorganized prof I've ever taken.

Complete joke of a teacher. He lectures from incomplete slides and goes out of his way to it difficult. If you ever ask a question, expect him to not understand your question or expect for him to answer with another question. He once came to class late to talk about fetus's for an entire hour before extending the class to talk about actual CS. RUN
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The only reason I'm not putting a one is because his lectures did cover exam material, if you somehow manage to follow along. Almost always answers questions either with another question, or something so abstract it makes no sense. I had to tutor 4 of my classmates so they could pass and the only reason I passed is because I'm experienced in coding

very vague with his instruction and we barely get any feedback. Our syllabus has been revised/updated six different times and it's hard to keep up with assignments because everything is just so unorganized. Assignments and quizzes feel like busy work. Never taking this guy again.

Every quiz has had incorrect answers, and when confronted about it with ample evidence he continues to deny. A very disorganized online class, and it feels like he puts literally zero effort into it. Also gives no feedback on anything so you are left with no idea on how to improve.
Most of the problems with this professor stem from the CSE program at KSU. His class is amazing.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Hossain delivered a quality experience. I had him for the lecture portion of 1322. I did not have much trouble with his accent and appreciated his efforts in demonstrating the topics in a live coding structure. He supplies ample resources for us to learn and insists that we ask any questions we have.

If I am being 100% honest, Professor Hossain is the worst professor I've ever had. This is a lecture heavy class, but he isn't engaging during them and rambles quite a bit. On top of that, he shows no mercy if you need an extension on a test because of internet problems or something of the sort. Do yourself a favor and choose any other professor.

He just goes through the fye powerpoint and shows us random samples of code, but he doesn't really follow along with what fye requires, like using IntelliJ and showing us all the stuff we have to know to complete our labs. His explanations aren't the best either. There are a lot of resources outside of class that you can use, so that helps.

Professor Hossain's course is definitely a course where you have to listen closely to what he is saying. Most of the things he teaches will be on the test. Just make sure to learn some things on the side and talk to other students about some stuff that would be helpful to know for the test.
Couldnt really understand him at first but you will eventually get used to it. His test are kind of bad since they are in a text box instead of coding in an IDE. Other than that his class is okay.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: The lectures are very boring and the professor stays out of the topic. The quizzes and tests are hard, so to get an A you should study a lot. He does a poor job of responding to emails. I learned mostly on my own because the lectures are not very helpful. I do not recommend taking this class.

The Professor just reads slides to you and shows you lots of "replit" codes that MAY show up on the upcoming exams. In which you'll have to constantly practice. Bc A large Majority of graded stuff in class are exams. Self-Study and working independently away from class will be needed of you because he provides little to no assistance for class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I only attended lectures at the beginning of the semester. His accent can be hard to understand and he likes to ramble. I used the provided PP slides as well as watching his lectures on YouTube from time to time. There is a lot of homework that can take an hour to many hours depending on your understanding of the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: It's very hard to understand what he is saying in his lectures due to his heavy accent. He goes off topic a lot and uses stupid analogies that are impossible to understand. He will CALL YOU OUT if you are on your phone. Attendance is not mandatory, so I just ended up teaching to course to myself. He never responded to any emails I sent him.

I do not recommend taking Mokter. Although he reviewed posted/recorded lecture material to d2l, it was incredibly difficult to follow his lectures. He went off topic frequently and he was NOT accessbile outisde of class. He never answered a single email I sent this semester. I recommend taking another teacher or just studying the lecture slides.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: For me, Mokter did a good job of using analogies in his lectures that helped me conceptualize some stuff and make it make sense. He is a nice guy, a bit goofy, and a bit disorganized. In my opinion, he does care about teaching students but sometimes his methods and analogies are really hit or miss. He uploads his lectures onto Youtube as well.

Where do I begin with Mokter? He spends every lecture rambling about irrelevant topics or information we've learned before (several times!). The tests are designed to trick you. Even though I learned a lot in 1322, all of it was self taught. Going to lectures is a waste of time because you won't learn anything.

CSE 1321 is structured really weirdly so I don't blame him for that. He just is not a helpful professor. He ignores emails, and only references you to his Youtube channel to learn information. I would definitely opt for another professor.

I love this Professor, He is so helpful and kind. He is always happy to help you at any time outside the class. His lectures slides are clear and precise. Listen his lecture video on each module. They are so helpful to understand the material. He always advise us to practice programming which is the easiest way to master the material.

If you are ok with watching recorded youtube lectures and don't stand up for your grades, you'll be fine with this professor. OMG I had SO many problems with this professor I don't have space to type. I was accused of not doing the homework, not watching his lectures, not learning the material, yet I got an A+. He is HORRIBLE if you need any help.

Not quite as bad as the other reviews might lead you to believe. In my experience, he was 20-30 minutes late to every class (including exam days), which was annoying. However, there is something to be said for the fact that if you pay attention to his live coding, he will show you EXACTLY how to do the problems that will be on the exams.

Professor Mokter has a very heavy accent that makes it really hard to understand his lectures. He is also very scatterbrained and takes the longest route possible to teach the simplest of topics. Tests are difficult and cover things that aren't useful. On the plus side, he does upload his lectures and you can easily pass by reading the slides.

The way Mr. Hossain is teaching is slightly not responsible. The material of CSE1321 and CSE1321L is not very organized. He is trying to teach and help the students. However, he dont care much if we can understand the lecture or not. Attendance may be taken through the Arkaive app. Please consider if you want to take his course.

I was not a fan of taking this course with Mokter. He primarily only teaches in Java even though the course is supposed to be taught in Java and C#. So if you are learning C#, do not expect much help with your specific language. I had to almost teach myself everything on my own. He has a thick accent and his thoughts can be disorganized at times.

He is not my favorite by any means however, he does upload each class onto his youtube channel so if you miss it, you won't feel like you're falling behind. I am not great at programming so this class was challenging for me.

His class was pretty chill. Some of his lectures are boring as he would ramble but he recorded his lectures and posted them on YouTube and posted his code on replit. He converts and does code in all three of the langues. Attendance is extra credit. Grades consisted of quizzes online at the end of each module and a three tests and the final.

The WORST teacher I have ever had. Gives little to no instruction on assignments. Tests contain extremely specific questions from the book; content given to study on d2l is never on tests. Responds email with broken english that is difficult to understand, and he is rude, derogatory, and simply not helpful when asking for help.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His lecture is incomprehensible, the lecture slides are terrible, and the test questions are difficult to understand. Unfortunately, the last two are outside of his control due to the fact that they are shared by the entire department, but he does not make it easy to pass at all. He also spends lots of time plugging his own YouTube channel.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He is a fine teacher. There is a language barrier, but the course is so basic you should be able to teach it to yourself fairly easily. He does not enjoy teaching CSE 1321. Attendance is not mandatory, but will be for extra credit. You don't need to attend every lecture because it's an easy A regardless.

Overall I think he is a solid choice for a professor. Some may complain about his accent but I did not find it an issue. I think he taught the best when he walked through the code and asked for student participation. He cares about the students and wants them to succeed, he would be willing to change if you told him what work the best for the class

Dr. Hossain is a professor that really knows his programming. He's a very lecture heavy professor, but he gives you all the right tools to succeed in his class. As he puts it, he shows you how to "walk" in the field programming. But it is ultimately up to you to "run". He records his lectures and posts them on youtube, which is really helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Not as bad as some reviews say. I like Mokter's lectures because of his weird analogies & jokes. The accent is hard for some, but the live code is helpful. Pay attention, use the resources, & practice code and you'll be alright. Mokter always says "I teach you to walk, and you teach yourselves to run," which is a valid description of the class.

For someone with absolutely ZERO prior programming experience, I did really well in this class, so clearly Mokter Hossain is doing something right. I selected "Lots of Homework" for the tags, but I really mean you just have to practice coding outside of class. I don't recommend taking a Monday lab, b/c not all the material is covered in 1 lecture.

Prof. Hossain is cool and funny,awesome lectures. Dont miss them. people think hes a bad prof. due to his accent,that is NOT TRUE! I made As on the quizzes,but didnt do so hot on the tests (there are 3) I didnt do well in his class because I am a beginner programmer and have trouble remembering codes to write on the tests.

Dr. Mokter taught me, not only about Computer Science, but about myself and who I am. Mokter inspires us to see beyond language and mathematics and understand computers on a personal level. He is like a second father throwing us into a pool to teach us to swim, but because he loves us.

Dr. Mokter Hossain does have an accent, but there was only one instance where I could not understand. He answers all questions to the best of his ability. He does a lot of live programs that help understand the topic. My one negative bit of feedback is that he will misunderstand the question and not answer the right question. Would take again.

He is a solid professor who does his best to introduce each lesson in ways that are easy to understand. Just bear in mind that if you miss class, you have no reason to complain about his teaching. To demonstrate that I learned something, I'll throw in a bit of pseudocode. WHILE(notInClasstrue) PRINTLINE "Don't complain about Fs" ENDWHILE

I swear he can not speak english to save his life. I already knew the content so I only went to tests and the final and ended up doing well but if you dont know how to code already, FIND A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR - you have been warned
He emphasizes on the most important materials in the curriculum. He 's a great professor who cares about the knowledge we acquire in the class. I would take him again if I have to.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: he tries his best to be fair by providing balanced examples for three programs a result he is the best teacher for the course.

I'm pretty sure that most of the good reviews on this site are him. He disregards any questions almost every class. His accent is thick and his grammar is poor which makes him hard to understand. His lectures don't help you with the tests, but the tests are close enough to the previous years tests that you can study by looking those up.
He is willing to work with you as long as you are willing to try

Great proffesor. I took his online class during the summer and found out that he gives you everything you need to do well in his class ( from videos, hard coded examples, pseudocode to powerpoints etc....). I would gladly take him again!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The professor really cares about his students and wants everyone to do well. He uploads his codes to GitHub and his lectures to YouTube so students can refer to them when studying. He replies quickly to emails and will clear all doubts about the course. The course in itself, was a bit challenging but the professor did his best to help the students.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Professor Mokter is a really great teacher if you pay attention to what he says. He knows a lot of good information and adds these information on his extra slides. Along with that, he takes a practical approach and teaches through programs in the computing languages needed for this course.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Although some do not like him, I found that he was a good teacher and is very knowledgeable and knows what he is talking about. He expects each student to put in the effort to learn for themselves and to use outside resources. At first, he may seem a little harsh and the accent can take some time to get used to but he was all in all a good teacher
His lecture was really helpful. There was 4 exams and online quizzes. His videos are helpful for the exams.

Mokter goes over material very well, he does repeat many of his same statements, however he simply want's to make sure his students understand the material. You do need to practice coding outside of class, which a lot of students don't. He does however have a heavy accent, but can easily be understood by just paying attention.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This one of the worst teachers that you can take; he is rude; not understanding at all; he also force to watch his videos which are long class of all people talking in addition to his heavy dialect. his quizez are all messed up and he never gives a second chance

I just want to start by saying this class is the toughest class and it is fundamental to know the real concept like how codings are working and why they are not working. Dr. Mokter Hossain is an excellent lecturer who knows how to inject the fundamental concept of programming(Java & c-Sharp) like a mother feeds her kids. He has a solid knowledge.

Pretty bad, but he's pretty much the only option for 1322. He has a thick Bangladeshi accent and he tends to mumble, so you have to use about 30% of your brain to understand what he has to say. Be sure to pay close attention and sit near the front. The lab is very helpful in this class and Youtube is your best friend while taking this course.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Hossain was one of the worse profesors I've taken in undergrad school. He doesn't know how to teach or explain lectures well. He make the test hard, I'm warning you DON'T take this professor at all. He is one of the worse professors all he talks about is coconuts.

This class was a challenge to say the least, but it wasn't the material it was the professor. does only examples done in the power points, which are always needing correction and mostly only codes in Java when its a pseudocode based class. Doesn't answer questions and is not what you consider a people friendly person. Read the reviews and avoid
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: alright maybe not as bad as reviews. hes ALRIGHT. if you cando accents youll be fine. The class itself is hard. its Computer Science theory. would be nice if he gave more examples and stuff. some homework worksheets might be nice too but he probably wouldnt. VERY LECTURE HEAVY. dont pay attention you basically fail. he totally wasnt my worst prof
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is quite rude when you bring up concerns and issues to him. When dealing with him about grades, I felt brushed off. I have attended every lecture, and he does make an effort to teach but the department has tied his hands in what has to be taught, ordering, and even the assessments they give us.

He is not very clear in his lectures and at times I find that he has a hard time staying on topic. Our department is clearly disorganized and confused and he has not bought any clarity to the situation. Unless you want to teach yourself using the textbook and watching a ton of youtube videos then I advise you choose a different professor.

This is a First Year Experience(FYE) for people who never took coding in their life. Here's the atmosphere; thick accent, doesn't explain things clearly/disorganized, be told what pseudocode is but not show how to do it, watch his videos which are his lectures and download the internet. you'll be taught more with a tutor or lab instructor.
Omg Omg I found the most kind-hearted terrible teacher here. I am in shock bi-weekly at his inability to communicate or present any comprehendible objective for the day. unbelievable....
What a guy. His lectures are always so inspiring and just puts you in awe. Take this class.... you'll love it....

First off, he lectures on things you haven't learned shortly after you have an assignment on that subject. Second, he is not 100% clear on some of the things he says, he takes forever explaining one topic and it usually takes the entire lecture. Now, you'd expect an assignment to get pushed back due to not being taught something, guess again.
